Dame Louisa Innes Lumsden (1840-1935), 4 July 1925

Dame Louisa Innes Lumsden DBE (31 December 1840 – 2 January 1935) was a Scottish pioneer of female education. When Scottish suffrage organisations organised the planting of The Suffrage Oak to mark some women getting the vote in 1918, Lumsden at age 78 was given the 'honour' of planting the tree.

properties.title: Tide Gauge, Thomson, 1st Baron William Lord Kelvin of Largs

descriptions.value: Tide Gauge; This tide gauge, the second of three instruments made for the Clyde Docks, consists of a fourteen day pendulum clock mechanism. It drove a chart drum on which was drawn a pencil record of the height of water in the dock.

In 1819 economic depression revived the radical cause. 'Union societies', based on the ideas of English radical Joseph Brayshaw, helped to provide a framework for secret meetings to plot the overthrow of the government.
